text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/709664cca0b59b69caa1ed40ebfcf00b2c672693|patch 8.2.2131: Vim9: crash when lambda uses same var as assignment>
patch 8.2.2131: Vim9: crash when lambda uses same var as assignment

Problem:    Vim9: crash when lambda uses same var as assignment.
Solution:   Do not let lookup_local change lv_from_outer, make a copy.
            (closes #7461)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2131: Vim9: crash when lambda uses same var as assignment · vim/vim@709664c
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2131: Vim9: crash when lambda uses same var as assignment · vim/vim@709664c
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: crash when lambda uses same var as assignment. Solution: Do not let lookup_local change lv_from_outer, make a copy. (closes #7461)

patch 8.2.2130: Insert mode completion messages end up in message history

Problem:    Insert mode completion messages end up in message history.
Solution:   Set msg_hist_off. (closes #7452

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/0ea7421ae6618fe8efe9e3afc8fdcf7a4d89739a|patch 8.2.2129: MS-Windows: Checking if a file name is absolute is slow>
patch 8.2.2129: MS-Windows: Checking if a file name is absolute is slow

Problem:    MS-Windows: Checking if a file name is absolute is slow.
Solution:   Do not use mch_FullName(). (closes #7033)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2129: MS-Windows: Checking if a file name is absolute is slow · vim/vim@0ea7421

attachments.text: Problem: MS-Windows: Checking if a file name is absolute is slow. Solution: Do not use mch_FullName(). (closes #7033)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/100118c73ac068137cd298d22953896242752523|patch 8.2.2128: there is no way to do something on CTRL-Z>
patch 8.2.2128: there is no way to do something on CTRL-Z

Problem:    There is no way to do something on CTRL-Z.
Solution:   Add VimSuspend and VimResume autocommand events. (closes #7450)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2128: there is no way to do something on CTRL-Z · vim/vim@100118c

attachments.text: Problem: There is no way to do something on CTRL-Z. Solution: Add VimSuspend and VimResume autocommand events. (closes #7450)
